WorkItem.ClosedComment: We no longer parent the TS file above the JS file, so you should see the right behavior now.
WorkItem.Description: Renaming a ts file does not rename the js, js.map, min,js files. These has to be deleted and regenerated
WorkItem.Summary: Renaming ts file does not rename underlying files

Comments.Message: Thanks for the report, this has come up a few times and is indeed annoying, marking as active.

Just tried it and problem remains. The js files are still underneath the ts file and are still not renamed.

-Thomas
This is fixed in the new project templates in 0.9.1.0; existing projects are unaffected (basically you should delete the .js child item and re-add it as a sibling project item)

ok, i see. If you have both min and map turned on it will generate lot's of files in my project folders. It doesn't seem like the optimal solutions. Also when renaming i will still have to delete->add or manually rename the auto generated files.
